description: Noël Coward’s riff on the Horse’s Neck is a classic Prohibition-era cocktail that appears in his 1951 play, Relative Values. More to the point though he touts it as the ultimate hangover cure – the Angostura Bitters and Ginger Ale will settle the stomach, the aspirin will clear your head and the Brandy is there to soothe your soul.

directions.instructions: In a Collins glass, combine Brandy and Angostura Bitters and stir. Add ice and top with Ginger Ale

description: If you are after a little colour and froth, then the Purple Haze Sour is the fruity Whiskey Sour riff you’ve been looking for. This cocktail mixes Bain’s Single Grain Whiskey, Sweet Vermouth, Blueberry Puree, Apple Juice, a blend of Lemon & Lime citrus, Sweet Vermouth, Vanilla Syrup, Bitters, and Aquafaba for that bit of foam.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients in an ice filled shaker, then strain into a chilled coupe
directions.garnish: Dehydrated citrus with rose hip flower and hibiscus dust

description: When it comes it comfort cocktails, there is nothing better than an Old Fashioned, but if you want to take that comfort factor up a notch, then 1800 Tequila’s Cinnamon Smoked Old Fashioned can’t be beat. The smokey complexity of Añejo Tequila mixed with the smoked from the grated cinnamon, and the citrus notes of the Orange Bitters will make this drink a favourite.

directions.instructions: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass filled with ice. Stir down until combined and chilled. Add ice to an Old Fashioned glass and stir until the glass is cold, then tip out ice from the glass. Light tip of cinnamon on a flat plate using a lighter or blow torch and place the chilled glass over the end once it starts smoking. Once filled with smoke, flip over and immediately fill the glass with ice again. Strain cocktail into glass

description:
While you could just think of the Going Out West cocktail as a Rye Whiskey and Mezcal riff on an Old Fashioned, the drink is made just that little bit more special with the addition of Averna.
“Smashing the modern day expectation of too much work and not enough play, the nightcap ensures that early nights and bourgeois banality are pushed aside for one evening at least. Yet Vanessa often found that the conversations she had when drinking a nightcap were, like the drink itself, tinged with equal amounts of pleasure and regret.”

directions.instructions: Stir all ingre3dients in an ice-filled mixing glass and strain onto an ice-filled glass

description: Wonderfully aromatic with a medium-dry finish, the Coronation Cocktail No. 1, is one of those classic drinks that you’ve probably never heard of but certainly won’t regret making. The delicate notes of almond from the sherry and fruitiness from the maraschino work beautifully when added to the Dry Vermouth and Orange Bitters.

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients in an ice-filled mixing glass and then strain into a chilled glass
directions.more_about_this_drink: Taken from Harry Craddock’s 1930s The Savoy Cocktail Book.

description: Making its first appearance mid last century, the Rusty Nail is the very definition of a classic.  But classic or not, the proportions used of Scotch to Drambuie vary widely. We tend to prefer a 3:1 ratio but it really is just a matter of taste.

directions.instructions: Stir ingredients with ice and strain into an ice filled rocks glass.
directions.more_about_this_drink: believed to have been first created in the early 1940s, it was popularised in the 1950 at Club 21 in New York.

description: Ginger Liqueur can bring a semi-sweet, semi-spicy flavour to cocktails that are truly refreshing and perfect for summer. The Ginger Snap created by Gary Regan in 2007 is a well balanced Gin Collins-style drink with Gin, Ginger Liqueur, Triple Sec, Lemon Juice, Angostura & Soda Water.

directions.instructions: Shake first five ingredients with ice and strain into an ice-filled collins glass, Top with Soda Water

description: Created by Erin Ward at Carmine’s, the Amaretto Sidecar is a nutty version of the classic cocktail The Sidecar. Replacing Cognac with Amaretto, this drink is the perfect end-of-week relaxer.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker, then strain into a chilled martini glass

description: If you are a fan of the classic Sidecar cocktail, then you will love the Asian inspired, Tokyo Sidecar. While keeping the Cointreau from the original recipe, this riff swaps out the Cognac for Japanese Whisky and the Lemon Juice for Yuzu Juice, for a bright cocktail that will certainly take you on a journey.

directions.instructions: Add all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake, and strain into a chilled Martini glass.

description: If you are after a Sazerac-style drink but with both Bourbon and Cognac, then the Black Rose is perfect for this evening. Slightly fruitier than its new Orleans cousin, this drink is sweetened with a little Grenadine rather than a sugar cube and seasoned with both Peychaud’s and Angostura Bitters.

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, then strain into a chilled but empty (no ice) glass.

description: Back in the 1950s when A-bombs were being tested in Nevada, an unknown bartender in Las Vagas came up with a little drink called the Atomic Cocktail. With Vodka, Cognac, Amontillado Sherry & topped with Brut Champagne, all we can say is this is a drink to handle with care.

directions.instructions: Shake first three ingredients with ice and fine strain into a chilled glass. Then top with Champagne.

description: If you like your Negroni on the drier side, then make yourself The Tunnel Negroni as created by Franck Audoux owner of the Cravan in Paris. With the usual amount of Gin, this drink hen uses an equal amount of Dry Vermouth but then less Campari, which is filled out with a bit of Sweet Vermouth.

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients in an ice-filled mixing glass, then strained into a chilled Nick & Nora glass

description: Adding a little smoke and pineapple tartness to the classic Old Fashioned, the Smoked Pineapple Old Fashioned is the perfect summer riff. Mixing Bourbon, Pineapple Syrup and Tiki Bitters, this drink is perfect for summer barbeques and beachside imbibing.

directions.instructions: Light a bit of dehydrated pineapple on fire, and cover with rocks glass to extinguish and capture smoke. Stir cocktail with ice, strain into glass, garnish and serve immediately.

description: If you think your Greyhound cocktail needs a little bit of European flair, then add a bit of Campari to the mix to create an Italian Greyhound. The Campari ups the bitterness of the grapefruit … not a lot, but basically by the required amount …

directions.instructions: Add all ingredients to an ice-filled shaker. Shake and strain into an ice-filled glass

description: This tall, refreshing, Aperitif-style drink was created by the Spanish Martini brand ambassador, Ignacio Vázquez in 2015. The Summer Americano mixes Sweet Vermouth, Campari, Suze & Cardamom Bitters before being topped by Tonic Water

directions.instructions: Stir first four ingredients with ice and strain into an ice-filled glass. Top with Tonic Water

description: Created at Perla Negra, the Ume Sangria embraces all the fruit flavours that you love from a Sangria but without all the fuss. Mixing Ume Plum Liqueur, Pinot Grigio, White Rum (we’re using Ten To One), Simple Syrup and Lavender Bitters, this drink is perfect for a mid afternoon indulgence.

directions.instructions: Build all ingredients in an ice-filled glass

description: If you want to take your Negroni in a slightly more exotic direction, then do as the bartenders at Whisler’s in Austin did and make a My Fair Lady. Using the ever versatile Pisco as the primary spirit (instead of Gin), this drink uses Cocchi Americano and Grapefruit Bitters, as well as the usual Campari

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients in an ice-filled mixing glass and then strain over a large ice cube.

description:
When this drink was created by Erick Castro at Polite Provisions in 2019, he used a ‘grasshopper salt rim’ (with sea salt and dehydrated grasshoppers). As grasshoppers (dehydrated or otherwise) are not always easy to find, we suggest just using sea salt. Either way, the mix of Mezcal, Sweet Vermouth, Strega and Grapefruit Bitters creates a drink that’s beautifully loaded.
“While a nightcape is usually drunk at the end of the night as a way to unwind, Vanessa often used the drink as a jumping off point to discuss everything from philosophy to popular culture. Well-read and surprisingly eloquent (especially with a few Mezcals under her belt), there are few who would not say ‘that girl is a pistol’ when describing her 2am soliloquies.”

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients in an ice-filled mixing glass and strain into an ice filled glass

description: One of our favourite classics, the Old Fashioned is basically a glass of booze sweetened with sugar and seasoned with Bitters.  So grab a glass, an once or two of Bourbon, a sugar cube and a dash or so of Angostura and Orange Bitters and experience this classic for yourself.

directions.instructions: Place sugar cube in an Old Fashioned glass, then add a few dashes of Angostura and water before muddling. Add Bourbon and ice and stir to chill.
directions.more_about_this_drink: The first use of the name “Old Fashioned” for a Bourbon whiskey cocktail was said to have been at the Pendennis Club, a gentlemen’s club founded in 1881 in Louisville, Kentucky.

description: Believed to be one of the first Vodka cocktails in the US, with references going back to the mid-1930s, the Gypsy Queen is a complex drink with flavours of spiced honey and herbal notes. With a simple stir of Bénédictine and Bitters, this drink could easily become a favourite.

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker and strain into a Nick & Nora glass

description: If you love a dessert-like cocktail then the Trifle Cocktail is a drink that is not to be trifled with. The combination of Raspberry flavoured Vodka, Black Raspberry Liqueur & Drambuie make this a drink worth indulging in at the end of the night.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and fine strain into a chilled glass
directions.more_about_this_drink: Created by Ian Baldwin at GE Club, London

description: My love of Margaritas and delicate aperitifs inspired my creation for this year’s Patrón Perfectionist. The balance of Jasmine and Mandarin allows for the quality and naturally occurring notes of Patron Silver to shine through – Corina Retter – Capitano – Melbourne

directions.instructions: Place a slice of mandarin orange skin and a pinch of sea salt into a shaker. Add 20ml lime juice, 10ml Mandarin Orange juice, 15 ml Jasmine and Green tea simple syrup and 45 ml Patrón Silver tequila. Shake on cubed ice and strain to serve.
directions.garnish:
Jasmine Green Tea Syrup
15g of Jasmine tea flowers
500ml of 75 degree water
300g of caster sugar

description: If you are after a simple, yet wonderfully spicy Whisky cocktail then you can’t go past a Whisky Mac. With only two ingredients – a good blended Scotch and Green Ginger Wine, this drink is the ideal sipper for the end of a long day.

directions.instructions: Pour ingredients into an ice filled glass and lightly stir

description:
The Sunset Sour uses the classic template of a Whiskey Sour, but with the addition of some Raspberries and Orange Juice, to create a a beautiful gradient cocktail, with the dehydrated orange garnish representing the sun over a cloud of foam.
“The fact that their friends had turned up was an overwhelming relief for Vanessa. It wasn’t that Juan (her faithful PA) wasn’t fun to hang with, but his time with the local ranger had lead to an ongoing commentary on the birds of upstate New York, which was seriously beginning to drive Vanessa to drink (a rather tasty Sunset Sour, if you please).”

directions.instruction: Muddle whiskey and raspberries in a shaker, before adding lemon juice, simple syrup, orange bitters, and egg white. Add ice to the shaker and shake. Double strain into an ice-filled rocks glass. Slowly pour 1 oz of orange juice into the cocktail against one of the glass’ walls. Finally, add 2 dashes of orange bitters over the foam

description: Winning 20 out of 21 races during the season in 1919-1920, Man O’ War was considered one of the greatest racing horses to ever live. Therefore it’s only fitting that the drink that bears his name is also outstanding with Bourbon, Cointreau, Sweet Vermouth, Lemon Juice and Simple Syrup.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice ad fine strain into a chilled glass
directions.more_about_this_drink: Although it is unclear who invented the drink, it is believed to have been invented in the mid-20th Century. At that time, 1oz of Cointreau and 0.5oz of Lemon Juice were used.

description: With a nice swing between sweet and sour, the Fig Sidecar makes a tasty riff on the classic. So, yes, as well as the Fig Liqueur, there is the usual Brandy, Cointreau and Lemon Juice that all maks this drink divinely tempting.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker, then strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

description: The drink I’ve created for the Patrón Perfectionists competition represents the concept of a journey. It tells the story of how, over time, our personal journey influences everything, and everyone, around us. My drink is also an homage to my staff, and the way we grow together and learn from each other – Pauric Kennedy – Baragaroo House – Sydney

directions.instructions: Build ingredients in mixing glass. Stir and strain over ice block. Express oils from lime peel over drink (keep the remaining peel for the leather). Garnish with pineapple & lime leather.
directions.garnish: *Pineapple shrub: Cook 400gm of cut pineapple until it begins to soften, stirring well. Then add 400gm sugar and 450gm water, and bring to the boil with mixing to dissolve sugar. Once mixture boils, lower heat to a simmer and leave for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and cool. Then strain through a chinois. Once Pineapple syrup is fully cooled, mix 3 parts of Chardonnay vinegar with 2 parts of the pineapple syrup. Et Voila!

description: Believed to be created by Harry MacElhone at Harry’s Bar in Paris, Between The Sheets is a rum riff on a Sidecar. With Gold Rum, Cognac, Cointreau and Lemon Juice, the name refers to the drink’s potency and the potential for a risqué end to an evening.

directions.instructions: Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker. Add ice and shake until chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe or cocktail glass.

description: If you are after a Margarita riff that has a slightly more healthy spin, then the electro lights in coconut water and the antioxidants in ginger make the Coconut Ginger Margarita the perfect choice.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, then strain into an ice-filled rocks glass
directions.more_about_this_drink: This recipe comes via cointreau.com

description: Created by Andres Juarez at Raines Law Room, the Plum Role is a long, refreshing drink that mixes Gin, UME Plum Liqueur, Jasmine Tea Syrup and both Grapefruit and Lime Juice, before being topped with Soda Water.

directions.instructions: Shake the first five ingredients in an ice-filled shaker, then fine strain into a Collins glass with ice. Top with Soda Water.

description: When the weather is warm there is nothing like the flavour hints of Basil, Ginger and Tequila mingling with watermelon to create a long, fruity and refreshing drink that we like to call a Watermelon & Basil Smash

directions.instructions: Cut up watermelon and muddle it with Basil in the base of a shaker. Add all other ingredients and shake with ice, before fine straining into an ice-filled glass. Top with Ginger Ale.

description: Wonderfully floral and balanced, the Tango cocktail is as dynamic as it’s namesake. The botanical nature of the gin works as a wonderful base allowing the Passionfruit Liqueur and the Ruby Grapefruit Juice to dance with each other in harmony.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and served into a chilled Martini glass
directions.more_about_this_cocktail: This drink is an adaption of one that was served at the Bellagio, in Los Vegas in 2013

description: The Gin Gin Cocktail is as simple as it sounds, a wonderful little mix of Gin and Ginger Wine. As simple as it may be, don’t let the  unassuming nature of this cocktail fool you, it has a nice spice while being surprisingly good.

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into an ice filled glass.

description:
With a nice bite of Cynar, the Mezchine Head is a drink that has a smoky, ginger, yet definitely tropical flavour that would make it equally at home on a beach in the south pacific, as it will be on your drinks trolley.
“What Vanessa loved most about an opening night was the guaranteed casting couch calibre of the crowd. While Juan, her faithful PA, contemplated the use of Mezcal in a variety of tropical libations, Vanessa kept on eagle eye on the door, ever on the look out for husband no 3.”

directions.instructions: Add all of the ingredients to a shaker with ice. Shake and strain into the glass over fresh ice, then garnish.
directions.garnish: Put the ginger in a blender and carefully add the hot water and honey. Firmly place and hold the blender’s lid, then blend thoroughly. Allow the mixture to cool, then fine strain into a bottle, seal and refrigerate. Use within a week.

description: With the best possible name that a cocktail could ever have, we present a Bee’s Knees riff, the Oldest Living Confederate Widow. When you mix Gin, Honey Syrup, Lemon Juice, a couple of dashes of Orange Bitters & a dash of Absinthe, it makes for a truly refreshing cocktail.

directions.instructions: In a Cocktail shaker, combine ingredients over cracked ice and shake.  Strain into coupe.
directions.more_about_this_drink: Created by Toby Malone at the Violet Hour in Chicago

description: While the name of this drink is something you should never say aloud except into a CB radio, the Papa Bear provides a delicate spiced and honeyed Cognac flavour. Created in 2008 by Tim Homewood at the Dirty Martini Bar in London, it mixes Cognac, Honey Liqueur, Lemon Juice and Honey Syrup.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and fine strain into a chilled cocktail glass

description: Obviously a riff on the classic Rusty Nail, the Mexican Nail incorporates the flavours of Drambuie and the peatiness of a single malt Scotch but adds another layer with the addition of Reposado Tequila for a nice complexity.

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into an ice-filled glass
directions.more_about_this_drink: Created by Simon Difford at the Cabinet Room, London in 2010

description: Long and tropical in feel, the Dingo is a sweet, fruity cocktail that’s, luckily, not too clawing, but comes with a nice little kick, and courtesy of the Rum and Whiskey in the mix.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker, then strain into an ice-filled Collins glass

description: The Dandy Lion can only be described as a grown-up riff on a classic G&T. With muddled Cucumber, Absinthe and a little Lemon Juice, all added to the expected Gin & chilled Tonic Water, this is a riff with a little more sophistication.

directions.instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the cucumber, then add Absinthe and let sit for about 30 seconds. Add ice, then the Gin, Lemon Juice, and Simple Syrup, and shake vigorously. Strain into a Collins glass and top with tonic

description: The White Manhattan not only pays homage to the early days of Moonshine but also to its namesake. It blends and balances White Whisky with Dry Vermouth, then brings out the citrus notes of the Lillet Blanc with the addition of Orange Bitters.

directions.instructions: In a mixing glass filled with ice, add all ingredients and stir until chilled. Strain into a chilled Coupe glass.

ingredients: 4 oz. Cold Brew oat Milk Latte
description: No matter what time you intend to wake up, there is no better way to start a weekend morning than with a coffee cocktail. Mixing Bourbon, Caramel Syrup, a little Cold Brew Oat Milk Latte, a whole egg and a dash of Mole Bitters, the drink will certainly help start the weekend right.

directions.instructions: Hard shake all ingredients without ice, then add ice and shake again. Strain into a chilled brandy balloon.

description: The Elixirita is basically a Tommy’s Margarita with a splash of Cognac. It was created by H.Joseph Ehrmann and is the signature Margarita at his bar Elixir in San Francisco and mixes Reposado Tequila, Lime Juice, Agave Syrup and Cognac.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and fine strain into a chilled glass

description: The Modern Pink Gin is a nice little riff on the original that of course includes Gin and the Angostura Bitters but for modern tastes, add just enough Simple Syrup to highlight the sweeter elements in the gin and the bitters.

directions.instructions: Add all ingredients to an ice-filled mixing glass and stir. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

description: A classic Key West cocktail, it’s easy to think of the Rum Runner as a fruitier rum version of a Singapore Sling, but this drink is certainly more than the sum of its parts and is a fusion of sweet fresh fruit and spicy rum.

directions.instructions: Shale all ingredients with ice, then strain into a hurricane or highball glass

description: A riff on the quintessential summer cup cocktail, the Strawberry Pimm’s Cup is similar to the original, except that the Strawberries are soaked in Pimm’s overnight, so as to up the Strawberry flavour of the overall drink.

directions.instructions: Soak a punnet of Strawberries in Pimm’s overnight. Then build ice, strawberries, cucumber, fresh mint, lemon, and lime slices in a large pitcher. Pour in the Pimm’s, Lemon Juice, Lime Juice and Ginger Beer. Finish with the Soda Water and stir.

description: If you substitute the gin from a Last Word for Irish Whiskey, then you get an Dublin Mistrel. Named after Frank Fogarty, a vaudeville perormer nown as the Dublin Minstrel, te drink mixes Irish Whiskey with Green Chartreuse, Lime Juice and Maraschino Liqueur.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker and strain into a chilled glass

description: When it comes to creating a riff on a Cosmpolitan, the Honey Cosmopolitan is the perfect example of what balance can achieve. Using the Cranberry Juice and Lime Juice from the original, this drink adds Grapefruit Juice and Grapefruit Vodka for the citrus elements and honey syrup for its delicious flavour and richness.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and fine strain into a cocktail glass
directions.more_about_this_drink: Created by Simon Difford at the Clocktower in Rye

description: There’s nothing more delicious or satisfying than a sour and with the inclusion of Figs, the Fig Sour definitely raises the bar. With Fig Liqueur, Galayya Liqueur, Lemon Juice and egg white, this is a drink that you’ll end up craving.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker, then strain into a chilled glass

description: Grab a towel, your sunglasses and find a place by the pool, cause it’s time for an iconic classic cocktail. First made in Puerto Rico back in 1952, the Piña Colada is a sweet drink made with White Rum, Coconut Cream and Pineapple Juice.

directions.instructions: Pulse all the ingredients along with a handful of ice in a blender until smooth and pour into a tall glass

description: The most famous of the Aperol cocktails, the Aperol Spritz is the refreshing taste of summer; perfect for sipping as the afternoon heat dies down. Made with the lovely, yet slightly bitter taste of Aperol, and fizzed up with Soda Water & Prosecco, the vibrant orange colour and flavour of this aperitif is unmistakable.

directions.instructions: Fill a Collins glass with ice, then add Aperol, Soda Water and Prosecco

description:
A little smoky, a tad bitter but with a nice floral element, La Parka is the cocktail for which you’ve been searching.  Just add some Mezcal and Lemon Juice to Punt E Mes and little St Germain and you’ll see what we mean.
“While Vanessa didn’t want to say goodbye to Singapore, she knew it was time to go. It was a great city with spectacular bars and even better bartenders, but her own city was waiting. Yet as she sat at the airport, with her new favourite Mezcal cocktail in her hand, she realised that this little sojourn had renewed her faith that living a life in liquid was always worthwhile.”

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients in an ice-filled mixing glass then strain into an ice-filled glass

description: No matter what other questionable choices Debbie has made, this is one drink that Debbie should definitely do. Created by Zachary Gelnaw-Rubin at New York’s Dutch Kills, this tasty little sour has Reposado Tequila, Averna, Lemon Juice & Maple Syrup

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled coupe
directions.more_about_this_drink: As the story goes, the drink is named after the ghost that haunts the bathrooms at New York’s Dutch Kills

description: While traditionally, an “Angel’s Share” is the term for the percentage of a whisky’s volume that is lost to evaporation, it is also the name of an amazing Cognac cocktail. With Orange Marmalade, Cognac VSOP, Licor43, Lemon Juice & Sugar Syrup, this cocktail has a wonderful citrus flavour with a  hint of Vanilla.

directions.instructions: Stir a heaped spoon of Orange Marmalade with Cognac in the base of a shaker until the Marmalade is dissolved. Add other ingredients, shake with ice and then fine strain into a chilled glass.
directions.more_about_this_drink: Created in 2005 by Milo Rodriguez in London

description: Described by some as having bits of a Brooklyn Cocktail and other bits of a Godfather Cocktail, the Brooklyn Godfather with Bourbon, Amaretto, Dry Vermouth & Sweet Vermouth is really the best of both worlds.

directions.instructions: Stir ingredients with ice and strain into chilled glass.

description: The Gin & Jam Cocktail is one that can easily be adapted to your tastes. We rather like it with Raspberry Jam but the joy of this drink is that any Jam will work equally well. A good floral Gin, some lemon Juice, Sugar Syrup and a little Jam and you are set.

directions.instructions: Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake forcefully (the Jam will put up a fight) but once it’s incorporated, strain into a stemless wine glass filled with crushed ice.

description: Nothing could be simpler or tastier than the Debonair Cocktail. Created in the 1990s by Gary Regan this rich, sophisticated Single Malt Scotch-based drink has a wonderful zing of spice from the Ginger Liqueur.

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled glass

description: As far as Kumquat cocktails goes, nothing is more refreshing than a Kumquat Quest. This drink is a crisp and citrusy combination of Vodka, fresh Lime Juice, Sugar and Kumquats, topped with Grand Marnier.

directions.instructions: Cut all the kumquats in half and put all the rest of the ingredients into a highball glass. Muddle all and add crushed ice. Float Grand Marnier.

description: Inspired by the Swedish concept of Fika (a ritual that emphasises the importance of connection, time out and enjoying a sweet treat or two), the nordic brand Flävar is here to tell you that Schnapps is back! So we start our pre-Christmas Schnapps journey with a Strawberry Kiss, which mixes Raspberry & Liquorice Flävar with Orgeat and Lime Juice.

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients in an ice-filled mixing glass, then pour into a highball glass with ice
directions.garnish: Dried orange and raspberries with a sprinkling of icing sugar for extra festive flair.

description: Phil Ward from New York’s Death & Co puts a nice floral twist on the Old Fashioned with his Elder Fashioned. With Gin, St Germain and the zesty citrus of Orange Bitters, this is a nice cleansing and boozy riff on the classic.

directions.instructions: Stir all the ingredients over ice, then strain into a double Rocks glass ice

description: Created by Shannon Mustipher, at Glady’s, Brooklyn, this elegant riff on the Parasol cocktail leans into Baijiu’s natural fruity flavour by combining it with Passionfruit Liqueur, Lime & Pineapple Juice to create the perfect summer drink.

directions.instructions: Add all ingredients to a shaker tine with ice and shake. Fine strain into a cocktail glass.

description: The Bushwick is a tasty Italian-American mix that was created by Phil Ward in 2009 when he was at Mayahuel in New York. It is, as you might assume from the name a riff on the Brooklyn with Rye, Sweet Vermouth, Maraschino Liqueur and Amer Picon.

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice in a mixing glass and strain into a chilled glass

description: Inspiration to make my cocktail comes from the culture, passion and feeling that is reflected in a bottle of Patrón. Culture of perfecting the tequila with passionate hand involved in the process and the feeling that emerges while drinking Patrón. This inspires me to make a drink, which not only tastes good but gives that aesthetic pleasure a feeling of warmth that urges people to order another one and a drink that is made by 100% blue agave Tequila – Pravin Phuyal – Hot Tamale – Darwin.

directions.instructions: In a mixing glass add Patrón Añejo, Martini Bitter, Jalapeno Tincture and saline solution. Add ice over the liquid. Mix all the ingredients for 14 stirs or until perfectly diluted. In a rocks glass add a clear ice cube. Strain the stirred mixture into the rocks glass. Garnish with hibiscus leaf.

description: A first sight, this seemingly impossibly spirit-forward cocktail appears to need more than A Moment Of Silence to be consumed, but the Apricot Brandy balances everything out and makes it much more approachable then you might suspect.

directions.instructions: Rinse a Rocks glass with Campari and set aside. In an ice-filled mixing glass, stir all other ingredients, then strain into the ice-filled, ore-rinsed glass.

description:
Inspired by the Indian tradition of having tea and cookies after a long workday, the Tea & Biscuit Flip was created at Saffron in New Orleans. The Cognac and Chai work beautifully together and are enhanced by the lemon Juice, Orgeat, Cardamom Syrup and whole Egg.
“When a bartender friend, Ivan, had said he had an idea to help her improve her cocktail game, Vanessa had not imagined meeting in a tea emporium. But the longer she stayed and the more flavours she experienced, the more she realised that her pride in making a simple syrup from Chai was, by comparison, relatively small fry.”

directions.instructions: Add all ingredients to a shaker (without ice) and dry shake. Add ice and shake again to chill. Strain into a chilled glass

description: If you are after a Moscow Mule riff that definitely has some kick, then you need to be making a Spicy Mule. It has the Vodka, Lime Juice and Ginger Beer of the original, but adds Cointreau and some slices of Jalapeño Pepper.

directions.instructions: Thinly slice the Jalapeño and muddle a few slices with Lime Juice and Cointreau in a Collins glass. Add ice and Vodka, then top with Ginger Beer

description: Refreshing and pink, the Honey Deuce is a Vodka-based cocktail that has been the official cocktail of the US Open since 2006. Named for the tie score of 40-40, known in tennis as ‘deuce’, this drink blends the flavours of lemonade, raspberry liqueur and honeydew.

directions.instructions: Build Vodka in a chilled Highball glass with ice, then top with Lemonade and Raspberry Liqueur

description: You’ve got to love a cocktail that mixes east and west and then throws in a little James Bond for good measure. The Reverse Vesper & Tonic is a riff on James Bond’s classic Vesper but reverses it with less Gin & Vodka, the addition of Lillet Blanc and a little Becherovka to help it along.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled glass
directions.more_about_this_drink: This cocktails was created by Simon Gifford in 2008 at the Cabinet Room, London

description: Derived from Jim Meehan’s 2011 The PDT Cocktail Book, the South Slope was created by Michael Madrusan and is named after the South Slope area of Brooklyn. With Gin, Aperol, Lillet Blanc, Orange Curaçao & Lemon Juice this is a very tasty aperitif.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and fine strain into a chilled glass

description: With a nod to the old luxury and style of the 1930s flights from Florida to Havana, the Pan Am Cocktail is a 2015 Bacardi Legacy winner. With White Rum, Aperol, Orgeat, Lemon Juice & Egg White, this is one drink that will transport you on an elegant escape.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain back into shaker. Dry Shake (without ice) and fine strain into a chilled glass.
directions.more_about_this_drink: This is the 2015 New Zealand Bacardi Legacy winning drink, created by Barney Toy from Meaculpa in Auckland.

description: Created by legendary bartender Dale DeGroff in New York City, the Velvet Fog Cocktail is hard to pass up. The Vodka, Falernum, Bitters and the juice of Limes and Oranges, create a tangy, fresh and bittersweet drink.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled glass

description: When Craig ‘Colonel Tiki’ Herman created this drink in 2010, it was served straight up in a coupe; David Selle later adapted it into this format. But either way, the Bourbon-laced, zesty Lemon Poison Dart has herbal complexity and cinnamon spice balanced with rich Orgeat.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker, then strain into an ice-filled glass

description: With Japanese Whiskey, Blanc Vermouth and bitters, the Drifter may feel similar to a few other stirred cocktails out there, but what will keep you coming back is the bittersweet complexity with delicate notes of apricot and saffron from the Amaro Nonino.

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients in an ice-filled mixing glass and stir gently. Strain into a double rocks glass over a large ice cube.

description: The perfect after-dinner drink, the Brainstorm utilises the herbal pungency of Bénédictine to highlight the smoky smoothness of the whiskey, while the dryness of the vermouth balances the sweetness of the Bénédictine, and the orange peel adds a hint of brightness.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients well with ice, then strain into a chilled cocktail glass

description: Chocolate-y and boozy, the Bourbon Ball is a drink that will dance delightfully around your taste buds with a tantalizing combination of Bourbon, Creme de Cocoa, Hazelnut Liqueur and Cream.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker, then strain into a chilled Martini glass

description:
“Lustre is a diligent stand in for gin in this White Negroni riff, which substitutes gentian—based Suze for Campari and orange-accented Lillet Blanc for Sweet Vermouth.” – Jim Meehan
Image – AJ Meeker

directions.instructions: Measure into a mixing glass, then add ice cubes. Stir and strain into a chilled rock glass filled with one large ice cube.

description:
A popular drink in New Orleans on a Sunday as it is reputed to have miraculous hang-over cure properties, the Brandy Milk Punch is an easy three-ingredient drink … just make sure you do not dry shake, as that will lead to eggnog.
“With the sun rising and the band on a well deserved break, Vanessa nipped behind the bar to shake up a New Orleans classic. Feeling a little like a Saint Bernard, as she ministered Brandy for the needy, she understood the importance of a little ‘hair of the dog’ for those poor souls stranded after closing.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into an ice-filled glass

ingredients: 2 oz. Alberta Premium Canadian Rye Whisky
description:
Back when Jim Meehan still had his Chicago bar Prairie School, they created a cocktail called the Canadian Sour, which (as you might assume from the name) takes a Canadian approach to a Whiskey Sour with Rye Whiskey and Maple Syrup.
“As their camping trip had taken them only a few hours from the Canadian boarder, Juan decided to ‘Canadian things up, eh’ with a Whiskey Sour that not only incorporated Maple Syrup but was built on the backbone of Canadian Rye Whiskey. Somehow Vanessa knew this was only going to lead to an afternoon of ‘Oh Canada’ jokes.”

directions.instructions: Shake the whiskey, lemon juice and maple syrup in a shaker tin with ice. Strain into a chilled coupe. Float the Malbec on top of the drink.

description:
Created by J.P. Fetherston and Alex Levy at the Columbia Room in Washington, D.C, the Cosmogroni is a Cosmo / Negroni mashup that retains the orange and Cranberry aspects on the Cosmopolitan but adds Aperol
“Years before Vanessa had dated a law student who had a strong belief that if you want to see how depraved people could be, you needed to study criminal law, but as she looked around at all the silly season micro-dramas that were unfolding before her, she realised that actually all you need to do was work in a bar.”

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients in an ice-filled mixing glass, then strain into a Rocks glass with large ice cube

description: Not since The Clash has there been a better reason to keep an ear out for London Calling. And with Gin, Sloe Gin, Sweet vermouth and Orange Bitters this is a traditionally styled sweet Martini with a dry, fruity finish.

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled glass
directions.more_about_this_drink: Created at Oxo Tower Bar & Brasserie, London

description: No matter what the season, there are some nights when you need the bittersweet of Averna combined with the bracing spice of Rye and the warmth of Allspice (Pimento) Dram. On those occasions, the Winter Waltz offers a whiskey-based spice bomb, of modern classic proportions.

directions.instructions: Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker. Add ice and shake until chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe or cocktail glass.

description: If you are after a bit of a boozy, but still delightfully fruity drink, then a Cassini might just be the ticket. With Vodka, Gin, Dry Cassis & Cranberry Juice, this drink is not overly sweet but still delightfully berry-licious.

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled glas

description:
If you are after a Whiskey Sour riff that is perfectly sweet but also nicely smokey, then a Rye-Blackberry Cocktail might be the cure. With Rye Whiskey,  Blackberry Preserve and Bruto Americano, this is the ideal late summer sipper.
“Since Juan, Vanessa’s faithful PA, had abandoned her to go out on a bird-watching hike with the quiet, although slightly sinister looking local ranger, Vanessa found herself having to make her evening cocktail herself. While normally she would have waited for Juan’s return before consuming her creation, the mere effort of crushing all that ice, had lead her to conclusion that sometimes cocktail-ing is hard work.”

directions.instructions: In a rocks glass, combine all of the ingredients, except for the ice and cinnamon stick. Fill the glass halfway with ice and stir to chill, then fill with more crushed ice.

description: Created by the late Sasha Petraske at Milk & Honey, The Business is a riff on the classic Bees Knees cocktail. Staying within the realm of the original, this drink is made a little snappier by the inclusion of Lime Juice instead of Lemon Juice.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and fine strain into a chilled glass

description: The perfect Whiskey-based dessert drink, the Liquid Bourbon Ball is drier, smoother and more indulgent than you’d think. With Bourbon, Crème de Cacao and a little Frangelico for good measure, this drink is not your typical chocolate cocktail.

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients in an ice-filled mixing glass, then strain into a chilled glass

description:
Nothing adds a more Christmas feel than adding some Christmas spices, and this is the trick that the Christmas Cosmo uses to give a bit of seasonal flavour to this Cosmo riff.
“As the temperature dropped, a little snow fell and everyone huddled into the bar. Mix that with the lights, the decorations and a little festive crooning and even Vanessa was ready to admit that it really was beginning to feel a lot like Christmas”

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker, then strain into a chilled coupe glass
directions.garnish:
Christmas-infused Vodka – Deseed half a fresh Chilli, then add three equally sized strips of peel from a
Clementine, a Lemon and a Lime. Add these, as well as a Cinnamon Stick, 3-4 Cloves and a few pink Peppercorns, to a large, dry, non-stick frying pan on medium heat. TYoast for a few minutes, then remove from the heat and let cool. Add all aromatics to a bottle of Vodka and let infuse for three days.

description: Sweet Vermouth and Port dominate this deep cherry red Negroni-like aperitivo, with Campri providing balancing bitterness. Four Poster Red was created by Simon Difford in 2018 at the Cabinet Room in London

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into an ice-filled glass
directions.more_about_this_drink: This drink can also be served shaken. If prepared this way, there should be a white head that covers the surface of the drink. The cocktail should be consumed before that head fades.

description: Dry Curacao becomes the star of this martini-style highball with Gin, Dry vermouth, Orange Bitters and Soda Water created by Greg Best at the Ticonderoga Club in Atlanta, GA

directions.instructions: In a mixing glass, stir all ingredients with ice and strain into an ice-filled highball glass, then top with soda water

description: Champagne replaces Dry White Wine in this ‘royal’ rendition of Mayor Canon Kir’s classic Aperitif. With Brut Champagne and Cassis this is one special drink that is not only easy to make but also oh so easy to drink.

directions.instructions: Pour Cassis into a chilled glass and top with Brut Champagne

description: Believed to have originated at the Noriega Hotel in Bakersfield, California, the Picon Punch has become somewhat of a signature drink of the Basque communities in the US. With Amer Picon, Grenadine, Soda & Cognac VSOP for a distinctly French aperitif.

directions.instructions: Pour first two ingredients into an ice-fille3d glass. Top with soda (leaving room for the Cognac). Briefly stir and then float the Cognac.

description: The Casper combines Reposado Tequila and Lime Juice with Orgeat. A riff on a Margarita, this drink is finished with rose water to complement the floral tequila, and nutmeg, to give an added layer of complexity and spice.

directions.instructions: Add the first 3 ingredients to a shaker with ice, then shake to combine. Strain into an ice-filled glass. Spritz with rose water and garnish.

description: Created in 2008 by Paul Mathew at The Hide in London, the Beginning Of The End is a riff on the classic Fin de Siècle except the gin is replaced with rum to create a balanced but complex bittersweet drink.

directions.instructions: Flame an orange zest twist into an empty glass. to line the inside with smoky oil. Then stir all ingredients with ice and strain into the pre-prepared glass.

description: Light, dry and crisp, the Flame Of Love is an iconic drink with a dash of theatre that is part elegance, part grace. Originally created by Dean Martin at Chasen’s in Beverley Hills, this legendary drink has a Hollywood feel and showcases how well sherry pairs with wheat vodka.

directions.instructions: Stir the spirits into a cocktail shaker. Strain into a well-chilled cocktail glass. Set aflame an orange zest over the drink, then use as a garnish

description: Created by Shawn Chen from RedFarm in NYC, the I Think She Got It utilises Ginger Liqueur, Fresh Ginger & Blackberries to show what Baijiu can really do. Added to these is Lime Juice, Sugar Syrup & Basil Leaves for a long drink that’s packed with flavour.

directions.instructions: Muddle chopped Ginger and Basil leaves in a shaker tin. Add the rest of the ingredients and fill with ice. Shake then strain into a Collins glass

description: Complex and herbal, the Monte & Mezcal is a riff on the Negroni that is as vibrant in flavour as it is in colour. With Montenegro Amaro, Select Aperitivo and Mezcal, this drink is the perfect stir-down pre-dinner or even at the end of the night.

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients in an ice-filled Old Fashioned glass

description: The Tia Mia is not only a riff but also an anagram of that famous tropical drink, the Mai Tai. With smokey Mezcal instead of White Rum, this twist on the original is like a Mexican spritz with a taste of the Caribbean.

directions.instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the Mezcal, Rum, Lime juice, Curaçao and Orgeat; fill with ice cubes and shake well. Strain into a chilled, crushed ice-filled rocks glass.
directions.garnish: Mint sprig, Lime wheel and edible flowers
directions.more_about_this_drink: Created by Ivy Mix at the Leyenda in Brooklyn

description: If you are looking for a variation from Gin in your Negroni then you can’t go past the smooth, delicate flavour with subtle fruit undertones of Rakia. Made with the same proportions as the original, a Rakia Negroni has an absolutely amazing taste.

directions.instructions: Fill an Old Fashioned glass with a good amount of ice, then add equal parts Rakia, Campari and Sweet Vermouth before stirring well.

ingredients: 0.85 oz. Tom Bullock's Old Tom Gin
description: Sweet and flavoursome, the Lanique Rose Petal Martini was first created by the legendary bartender Dick Bradsell, who mixed Lanique Liqueur with Old Tom Gin, Lychee Juice and Peychard’s Bitters.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker, then strain into a chilled Martini glass

description: Limoncello is definitely an underused liqueur in cocktails but make a Limoncello Collins, with Limoncello, gin and a nice topping of Soda Water and you’ll always have an easy crowd pleaser.

directions.instructions: Combine Limoncello and Gin in an ice-filled collins glass, then add Soda Water to top

description: Created in 2008 by Lewis Jaffrey, the Drambuie Global Ambassador, the Ancient Daiquiri is a lovely Daiquiri twist is heavily influenced by its herbal liqueurs. According to Lewis, the combination of Rum, Drambuie, Green Chartreuse, Lime Juice and Vanilla Syrup has a combined age over 650 years.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and fine strain into a chilled glass

description: Created by bartender Joaquín Simó at former East Village bar Pouring Ribbons, the refreshing High King Highball is a bright fruity highball that is not only visually appealing but also a delicious drink that easily converts anyone who believes that Irish Whiskey shouldn’t be in a cocktail

directions.instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the Raspberries and Simple Syrup. Add the Irish Whiskey, Aperol, Lemon Juice, Grapefruit Juice and Bitters into the shaker with ice, and shake until well-chilled. Fine-strain into a Collins glass over fresh ice and top with the Soda Water.

description: Created by Eric Tecosky from the Olive Juice company Dirty Sue, the Dirty Laundry shows that brine can be used for more than just a Dirty Martini. A fun mix of Vodka, Grapefruit, Agave and lemon, cucumber and bell peppers, this cocktail is vegetal with a bit of bite.

directions.instructions: Muddle cucumber and bell pepper. Add lemon and muddle. Add all ingredients and shake well. Double strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

description: “A lightly-roasted coffee with fruity florals —reminiscent of the berry the bean descends from—is the perfect pairing for Earthen in this alcohol free “copy” of the classic Irish Coffee.” – Jim Meehan

directions.instructions: Measure into a pre-warmed tempered glass or mug.

description: Named after the press slogan which allegedly provoked the 1898 Spanish-American War, the cocktail Remember The Maine is a twist on a Sazerac. This Rye cocktail is given a subtle sweetness with Cherry Liqueur and a hint of savagery from a dash of good Absinthe.

directions.instructions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with cracked ice, then stir well for 20-30 seconds and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

description: Definitely a crowd-pleaser, the Old Town Vodka Punch embraces all the best elements of a summer cocktail, from the sweetness of elderflower liqueur to the hints of bittersweet orange from Aperol.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker, then strain into an ice-filled glass

description: While it might initially look friendly and harmless, the Dalmatian packs an unexpected punch – a little bitter but still sweet, earthy and deep, with a little heat from the vodka and pepper combination … perfect to end the week. Created by Helen Rosner at saveur.com

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients in an ice-filled shake and strain into an ice-filled

description: The Party Cat Mezcal Cocktail is all about presenting fresh flavour with tangy grapefruit juice and sparkling wine. If you don’t have Cardamon Bitters on hand, then make your own by steeping 1 Tbsp. of crushed cardamom in 8 oz. of high-proof neutral spirit for 10 days, strain and bottle.

directions.instructions: Combine all ingredients, except the sparkling wine, and stir with ice. Strain into a coupe and top with sparkling wine.
directions.more_about_this_drink: Created by Chris Keil at Hilltop Kitchen in Tacoma

description: Greg Kong, beverage director for Kimika New York describes the bar’s Watermelon Cooler as a watermelon daiquiri at heart. With Ten To One White Rum, Trois Rivieres Cuvee L’Ocean, salted Watermelon Syrup, Aperol and a hint of chilli, the drink is rounded off with a little Lambrusco Rosso sparkle.

directions.instructions: Build in a shaking tin. Add all the ingredients except Lambrusco into a shaking tin. Whip shake with 3-5 pebbled ice. Strain into a snifter glass, add pebbled ice and top with Lambrusco.

description: Lychees make the perfect ingredient for a cocktail that is equally enjoyable with no-alcohol as it is with a little booze. The combination of Grapefruit Juice, Lime Juice, Honey Syrup, Lychees & Soda Water (Gin optional) has enough depth to be a truly tasty combo.

directions.instructions: Add Grapefruit Juice, Lime Juice and Honey Syrup to a shaker tin. Add the lychees (canned is easier) and muddle. Add Gin (if required) and shake before straining into a chilled cocktail glass. Top with Soda Water

description: Who among us doesn’t love a good pun but with For Sake’s Sake you not only get a good pun but also a good cocktail. With Sake (as the name suggests), White Rum, Italicus and Cointreau, this is a subtly orange sake and rum cocktail.

directions.ingredients: Stir all ingredients in an ice-filled mixing glass and strain into a Nick & Nora

description: A nice riff on David Wondrich’s Airmail cocktail, You’ve Got Mail mixes Cachaça with Citrus (Lime Juice & Orange Juice), which is balanced with Honey Syrup and then nicely and effervescently topped with Champagne.

directions.instructions: Shake the first five ingredients in an ice-filled shaker, then strain into an ice-filled glass. Top with champagne.

description: As you might assume from the name, this is yet another Negroni riff. If like us, you believe there can never be enough Negroni riffs, but would perhaps like yours a little lighter and sweeter, then this cross-continental drink with Tequila, Sweet Vermouth & Aperol won’t disappoint.

directions.instructions: Pour all ingredients in an ice-filled glass and stir

description: If you are after a slightly drier riff on an Aviation then throw out the Creme de Violette and make a Casino #1. With the usual Gin, Maraschino Liqueur and Lemon Juice, it is made drier and more complex with a dash of Orange Bitters.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients and fine strain into a chilled cocktail glass

description: If you haven’t indulged in a little White Whiskey (Moonshine, Hooch, Firewater, White Lightning etc), then a Strawberry Moonshine is the perfect place to start. With White Whiskey, Strawberry Jam, Lemon Juice & Soda Water, this drink is a good slow sipper on the porch.

directions.instructions: In a Cocktail shaker add Strawberry Jam, Lemon Juice and Moonshine. Stir with a long spoon until the jam dissolves, then add ice. Top with Soda Water

description: Whether you drink this as a citrusy Whisky aperitif or as a refreshing Scotch and Port wine nightcap, the Rosemary Tuck is definitely a winner. With Scotch, Tawny Port, Orange Juice, Sugar Syrup and Orange Bitters, this is a wonderfully warming balanced drink.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and fine strain into an ice-filled glass

description: If you are after a tropical cocktail with just about everything, then you can go past Jamaican Me Crazy. White Rum and Coconut Rum are the basis for this fruity concoction that includes the juice of Passionfruits, Cranberries, Oranges and Lime, as well as a little Grenadine for extra colour.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, then strain into a glass with crushed ice

description: This classic, bitter drink makes quite a few appearances in a number of the work of Bret Easton Ellis. In his memoir, White, he mentions the combo of Vodka & Grapefruit juice saying “I found her stillness intimidating, so as a hungover, shaggy twenty-one-year-old I ordered a midday vodka and grapefruit juice to settle my nerves”.

directions.instructions: Pour vodka into a rocks glass, then add ice and grapefruit juice (we’ve used a ruby grapefruit but a white grapefruit would work as easily).

description: If you’re after a spicy, smoky and sweet drink, then you can’t go past a Cave Creek Cocktail. With Rye, Scotch, Lemon Juice, Grenadine & Campari, this is the ideal whisk(e)y sipper for the end of a long humid day.

directions.instructions: Combine all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker. Shake, then strain into a highball glass filled with crushed ice.

description: At the end of the night, nothing beats a tasty, bittersweet Aperitivo like Little Italy. A Manhattan-like mix of Rye, Cynar and Sweet Vermouth, this drink was created by Audrey Saunders at Pegu Club in New York.

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled glass

ingredients: 0.75 oz. Carpano Antica Formula Sweet Vermouth
description: Named after the third installment of the Fast & Furious movie franchise, the Tokyo Drift is a delicate but boozy Japanese Whisky riff on the classic Manhattan, but unlike the film this drink is balenced and complex.

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients in an ice-filled mixing glass, then strain into a chilled Nick & Nora glass

description: Created in 2019 by Simon Difford at Clocktower in Sussex, the Grapefruit Crusta is a refreshing, zesty cocktail.  With Grapefruit Vodka, Pamplemousse Rosé Liqueur, Ruby Grapefruit Juice, Simple Syrup & Grapefruit Bitters this is easy-drinking at its best.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled glass with pre-custed rim
directions.garnish: Sugar rim & grapefruit zest around the rim

description: Not to be confused with a Tommy’s Margarita, the Tommi’s Cocktail is a delicate yet bittersweet aperitif. With Mezcal as the star, the drink backs this up with Aperol and Maraschino Liqueur.

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled glass

description: If you are after a cocktail the embodies a chocolaty, nutty, coffee flavour, then the Montgomery Slugger. should be your go-to. Created in 2013 at Maison Premiere in Williamsburg New York, this drink combines Bourbon, Vermouth, Coffee Liqueur, Falernum, Walnut Liqueur and Angostura Bitters in an Absinthe-rinsed glass.

directions.instructions: Coat a chilled cocktail glass with Absinthe. Separately stir all other ingredients in a mixing glass with ice and then strain into the Absinthe-coated glass

description: If you believe, as we do, that nothing beats a slightly spicy fizz cocktail, then In My Peel needs to be on your list of drinks to make. Created by Kelsey Ramage of Trash Collective, this drink features carrot peel-infused Vodka, spiced syrup, Amaro Lucano, Greek yogurt and Soda Water

directions.instructions: Make carrot peel vodka and spiced syrup. Add everything except soda into a cocktail tin with crushed ice. Give a quick hard shake. Pour everything into a Collins glass and top with soda.
directions.garnish: Curly Carrot peels (place carrot peels in ice-cold water for 10 min – they will curl).

description: We’re all for Negroni riffs and the Paper Tiger is a particular favourite. If you’ve been thinking that the only thing lacking from a Negroni is more spice, then this cocktail amps it up with the use of dark spiced Rum and Carpano.

directions.instructions: Combine all ingredients and stir with ice. Strain into an ice-filled glass

description: You know you are doing adulting right when you find yourself sitting outside on a barmy summer evening with a drink like a Gin Spritz in your hand. Floral and citrusy, sparkly and crisp, this drink is the perfect after-work libation.

directions.instructions: Add all ingredients to a large wine glass.  Top with ice.

description: A riff on the Whiskey Sour, the Old Elk Apple Sour provides a nice fruity twist without the foam. The Apple Brandy ensures the drink is not overly tart but has enough apple flavour to mix well with the Bourbon and Lemon Juice

directions.ingredients: Add all ingredients to an ice-filled shaker, then shake and strain into an Old Fashioned glass with a large, single rock of ice.

description: Slightly sweet, lemony fresh and perfectly boozy, Give A Fig is a great drink for an impromptu get together. With Bourbon, Fig Liqueur, Honey Simple Syrup & Lemon Juice, this is one drink you’re going to care about.

directions.instructions: Add all ingredients to an ice-filled shaker, then strain into a rocks glass.
directions.garnish: A drizzle of honey over a fig slice

description: Created by Ryan ‘Mr Lyan’ Chetiyawardana at Dandelyan London, the Three Storms Flip is a complex but silky smooth riff on a rum flip that has subtle hints of Peaty Scotch

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and fine strain into a chilled glass

description: Although the Tuxedo No.3 only uses a small amount of Sherry, it does change the overall impact of the drink. The original was first recorded in Harry Johnson’s 1900 Bartenders Manual and this is a later riff that changes the amount of Gin and Vermouth used, while also adding Sherry.

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled glass

description: A riff on a Gin & Tonic, the Peach & Tonic understandably has Peach as the star of the show. As well as Peach Liqueur, the drink has shaved ice from a frozen peach zested over the top

directions.instructions: Stir Gin, Peach Liqueur and Lime Juice in a Collins glass. Add ice, then top with Tonic Water

description: Who doesn’t love the flavour of Cranberry Juice, Rose Syrup and Strawberry Syrup? Mix them all together and add enough Vodka to show you’re serious and a little lemon Juice to cut through the sweetness and you’ll be a sweetheart in the making.

directions.instructions: Add all ingredients into an ice-filled shaker, then fine strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

description: Created by Rose’s Luxury in Washington, D.C., the Rose & Rye is a wonderful cocktail with which to start the night. Combining Rye, Rose Syrup, Lemon Juice & Bitters, this is a sprightly, pretty little cocktail, that is sure to delight.

directions.instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the whiskey, syrup, lemon juice, and bitters with ice. Shake vigorously, and strain into a chilled rocks glass.

description: The Yellow Jacket is an aromatic Tequila cocktail named for the wasps that swarm around agave farms and tequila distilleries. Herbal, musky, and bittersweet, this drink combines Reposado Tequila with St Germain and Yellow Chartreuse.

directions.instructions: Stir Tequila, St Germain, Yellow Chartreuse, and Orange Bitters together in an ice-filled mixing glass. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

description: Like all entertainers, Sandy the Showgirl has an interesting combination of ingredients but strangely pulls it off to create a drink that has a delicious floral smokiness. With Tequilas, Mezcal, Maraschino Liqueur, Agave Syrup and Lavender Bitters.

directions.ingredients: Stir all ingredients with ice and stain into a chilled glass

description: If you are looking for a new go-to variation on a Negroni, 1800 Tequila’s Jalisco Negroni is the perfect Agave update on the classic. Using the Campari and Sweet Vermouth that you expect, the drink just swaps out the Gin for Silver Tequila … easy!

directions.instructions: Add all ingredients to an ice-filled mixing glass. Stir down until combined and chilled, then strain into double rocks glass over ice

description: Perfectly balanced and easily sippable, the Mildred Pierce is a wonderful three ingredient cocktail. The smokiness of Mezcal, adds the necessary roughness to Aperol, Creme de Pamplemousse & Lemon Juice.

directions.instructions: Combine all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker. Shake well and strain into a chilled Nick & Nora glass.

description: I was really impressed with Patrón’s emphasis on the community, which inspired me to create a cocktail that reflects this, through the use of local and easily accessible produce – Sion Roberts – Dead Ringer – Sydney

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except Shiraz) with ice. Place one large cubed ice into frozen/chilled Rocks glass. Double strain into frozen Rocks glass (avoiding the ice block as to not distort the ice). Carefully Pour 10ml Shiraz on top of the drink, as float on top

description: For a completely different take on a Mint Julep you can’t go past the chocolatey goodness of a Thin Mint Julep. Reminiscent of Mint Thin Cookies, this cocktail adds a little Peppermint Schnapps and Creme de Cacao to the traditional Bourbon & Mint.

directions.instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice; add the Peppermint Schnapps, Creme de Cacao and bourbon. Shake until ice cold and pour over more ice in the rimmed glass.
directions.garnish: Dip the rim of a Cocktail  glass into a mixture of Peppermint Schnaps & Creme de Cacao and then coat with a mixture of Cocoa (1 Tbsp) and fine sugar (1 Tbsp) and then add a Mint leaf.

description: The Hemingway Daiquiri was created at the La Floridita bar in Cuba for Ernest Hemingway. Legend has it that he loved it so much that he always ordered a double, lending the cocktail its nickname of Papa Doble.

directions.instructions: Combine rum, juices, liqueur, and syrup in ice-filled shaker; shake. Strain over crushed ice into a cocktail glass

description: While a Hot Toddy is a perfect winter drink, that doesn’t mean you can’t drink it in summer. Drinking hot drinks when it is hot can cool the body down, and adding Tequila will make your heart grateful.

directions.instructions: Add honey to a cup with a dash of hot water and stir until combined. Add remaining ingredients and top cup with hot water. Leave cinnamon stick to steep until desired taste

description: Don’t get too worried by the name of the cocktail, as it is the perfect combination of dark spicy flavours. With Kraken Spiced Rum and Ginger Beer, there can be no better combination at the end of a long, hot summer day.

directions.instructions: Fill a rocks glass with ice, then add the Rum and top with Ginger Beer.

description: This simple, three-ingredient cocktail is the perfect summer sipper to have by the pool. The Pearl Harbour mixes Vodka, Midori and Pineapple Juice, this stunning green drink will have your friends Midori with envy.

directions.instructions: Pour the Vodka & Midori into an ice-filled glass then add Pineapple Juice

ingredients: 1.5 oz. Teelings Single Grain Irish Whiskey
4 dash Dr.Adam Elmegirab's The Dead Rabbit Orinoco Bitters
description: Created by celebrated bartender Pamela Wiznitzer, Head Of Steam is an Irish Whiskey stirred cocktail creates a wonderfully rich mix of Whiskey, Vermouth Sherry and Bitters

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients in an ice-filled mixer glass, then strain into a chilled cocktail glass
directions.garnish: Orange Twist (express the oil over drink, then discard)

description: With a well-balanced floral flavour, the Rose Martini makes the ideal summer sipper. Delicate but definately refreshing, this Martini riff combines Vodka, Rose Water, Sugar Syrup and a little Lemon.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker, then strain into a chilled Martini glass

description: Although fruit cups are traditionally made with Pimms (which is really a Gin based, herbal aperitif), they can also be made simply with just Gin and Vermouth. The Melbourne Fruit Cup as a combinations of Gin, Vermouth, Ginger Ale & Lemonade for the perfect summer sipper.

directions.instructions: Combine Vermouth & Gin in an ice filled Collins Glass and then gently pour in Ginger Ale and Lemonade.

description: When you get a drink with a split base of Rum & Scotch you might assume it’ll be a winter sipper. Yet when you add Dry Curacao & Coconut Water to the mix, as happens with the Scotch & Coconut Cocktail, it easily takes a turn towards the tropical.

directions.instructions: Freeze Coconut Water in large ice cube molds. Once frozen, combine all ingredients in a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a Rocks glass over the frozen Coconut Water ice.

description: Sometimes you just need the healing power of a simple three-ingredient cocktail like the Louisville Cocktail. With Bourbon, Lillet Rouge and Lillet Blanc, this drink is a spirit-forward, elegant, modern classic.

directions.instructions: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

description: Philadelphia’s contributions to cocktail history, The Clover Club pre-dates Prohibition and is named for the Philadelphia men’s club of the same name. With Gin, Raspberry Syrup, Lemon Juice and Egg White, this is a rich, silky-textured drink with enough sweet and sour to keep everyone happy.

directions.instructions: Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and dry shake. Add ice and shake again. Pour the drink into a chilled cocktail glass.

description: The Agave Margarita is, as it says on the box, a cocktail that contains Agave Syrup, instead of the traditional Cointreau. Super simple, it also uses Reposado Tequila instead of Blanco but otherwise, the Lime Juice remains the same.

directions.instructions: Rim your glass with salt, then shake all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker. Strain into a rocks glass.

description:
Created by Brooklyn bartender Ivy Mix, the Palo Negro is a mix of black strap rum, reposado tequila and Grand Marnier, which all work in harmony with the Palo Cortado sherry for a nightcap cocktail that works in perfect harmony.
“They say that you can’t really know a city until you’ve spent a night drinking with its inhabitants. If this is true then Vanessa felt she knew New York very well. After all, there’s not much that can remain hidden when you have both Tequila and Rum in the mix.”

directions.instructions: Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass over ice and stir until chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass.

description: Pan de Muerto, one of the most popular Día de Muertos offerings, is characterized by the inclusion of orange zest and orange juice. Like its namesake, the Pan de Muertos cocktail also features a tangy citrus flavour with the inclusion of orange liqueur.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into an ice-filled highball glass
directions.garnish: Caramelised orange wedge and 3 Pineapple leaves
directions.more_about_this_drink: The recipe and image for this drink were provided by Patrón Tequila

description: It might have a funny name but the GVC Cocktail definitely packs a punch. Named after it’s three ingredients – Ginger, Vodka & Cointreau, this drink is warming, tasty and the perfect drink to have with friends beside the fire.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients in an ice filled shaker and strain into an ice filled glass

description: Drunk Uncle may not be your favourite person but it should be your favourite cocktail. This spirituous cocktail has a savory, smoky flavour that mixes the peaty taste of Scotch and the vegetal yet bittersweet taste of Cynar, then balances them out with a little Bianco Vermouth.

directions.instructions: Add Scotch, Cynar, and Vermouth to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir until well chilled, then strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

description: If you need an island vacation but can’t really spare the time, then drink the next best thing, a Jasper’s Jamaican. This Jamaica-style Daiquari has a buttery base of Jamaican Rum and the nice strong spice of a Pimento Dram (or Allspice Dram).

directions.instructions: Combine rum, juice, liqueur, and syrup in ice-filled shaker; shake. Strain into a chilled glass

description: Inspired by the mists of Victoria Falls, the Royal Mukombe is a nutty drink with warm winter spices and stewed fruits. Created by Antony Mudzengerere for Gigi’s Rooftop, the Mukombe describes the gourd in which the cocktail of Cognac and Butternut brown spices is served.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker, then fine strain into a chilled coupe glass
directions.garnish: 4 drops of stained sesame seed oil, then place coupe in a gourd with sesame-scented dry ice smoke

description: Another refreshment typically served at a Día de Muertos celebration is fresh fruit water. With the Paloma Roja that idea is kicked up a notch by featuring Silver Tequila among grapefruit and lemon juices, and then St Germain,with a little Hibiscus Syrup

directions.instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake to chill and combine. Strain into a salt & dried hibiscus-rimmed collins glass filled with fresh ice.
directions.garnish: *Hibiscus syrup: In a heatproof bowl, combine 8 oz hot simple syrup with 2 hibiscus tea bags and let steep for 5 minutes. Discard the tea bags and let the syrup cool. Transfer the syrup to a jar, cover and refrigerate for up to 2 weeks.
directions.more_about_this_drink: Salt & dried hibiscus on the rim

description: Perfect for enduring the summer heat, a Blackberry Bourbon Smash is a great go-to drink when the temperature rises. With Blackberries, Bourbon, Mint, Lime Juice, Simple Syrup & Soda Water, you can serve this in a long or short glass depending on your hydration needs.

directions.instructions: In a shaker combine Mint, Blackberries and Lime wedges and muddle, before adding the Bourbon and Sugar Syrup. Shake with ice, then pour (unstrained) into a rocks glass  full of ice and top with Soda Water

description: Believed to have been created at New York City’s Manhattan Club, sometime around 1880, the Manhattan is a cocktail that is both timeless and tasty. Mixing American Rye Whiskey, Italian Sweet Vermouth and perked up with the inclusion of Angostura Bitters, it is the very definition of what a cocktail should be.

directions.instructions: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice, and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled glass.
directions.more_about_this_drink: Although it is traditional to make a Manhattan with Rye, other whiskies, like Canadian Whiskey, Bourbon and Tennessee Whiskey are often used.

description: This riff on the very popular Sbagliato has been created by The Queen, a secret bar that is about to open near the Queen’s Hotel in Cape Town. The Queen’s Sbagliato has a fruity vibe with Coconut washed Antica Formula and Straweberry infused Campari

directions.instructions: Add Antica Formula, Campari and Soda Water to an ice-filled Highball glass then top with Prosecco
directions.garnish: Campari soaked Strawberries and an orange slice

description: While you might think the Gimlet is a pretty perfect cocktail that doesn’t mean that it can’t be improved upon. And that’s exactly what Andrea Gualdi has done for Alibi, Sydney. By featuring Citadelle Gin, Chartreuse, Vermouth and a Basil Oil garnish, this drink has an unbeatable aroma and a silky mouth feel.

directions.instructions: Add all ingredients to an ice-filled shaker. Strain into a chilled ice-filled cocktail glass

description: If you are after a fruity classic, then you can’t go past the dry tartiness of a Sloe Gin Fizz. With Sloe Gin, Lemon Juice and Sugar Syrup, then top with Champagne, if you want to be fancy or Soda Water if you don’t.

directions.instructions: Shake Sloe Gin, Lemon Juice and Simple Syrup, then top with either Champagne or Soda Water
directions.more_about_this_drink: There are various versions of this drink – some include Dry Gin, some include Egg White – there are others still that swap out Simple Syrup for Angostura Bitters.

description: Made truly popular by the 1998 Coen Brothers film, The Big Lebowski, The White Russian is a simple, smooth mix of vodka, coffee liqueur and cream. So yes, it’s basically a Black Russian with Cream but nonetheless, a great sipping drink.

directions.instructions: Fill a rocks glass with ice and add vodka and coffee liqueur, then gently pour the cream over the back of a barspoon on top
directions.more_about_this_drink: The White Russian was created by Belgian barman, Gustave Tops at the Hotel Metropole in Brussels in honour of Perle Mesta, then U.S. ambassador to Luxembourg in 1949.

description: Inspired by the classic New Orleans Brandy Crusta, which is in itself a Cognac-based twist on the Old Fashioned, the Sidecar is a drink that will certainly take you for a ride. But understand, with Cognac, Cointreau and Lemon Juice, this really is just a gussied up Cognac sour.

directions.instructions: Add all ingredients to a shaker tin with ice and then fine strain into a cocktail glass.

description: Considered by many to be the best version of a Corpse Reviver, the Corpse Reviver 2 is a well balance libation, with zesty lemon and Absinthe shinning above all. Added to that, the Gin, Cointreau and Lillet Blanc, make this a concoction that definitely would revive a corpse

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and fine strained into a chilled glass
directions.more_about_this_drink: Adapted from harry Craddock’s 1930 The Savoy Cocktail Book

description: The result of a collaboration between Cause & Effect Cocktail Kitchen in Cape Town and Red Bull, the Rock To Fakie is as extreme a sport of cocktails gets.  It’s easy to skate into this cocktail with it’s mix of Bacardi Spiced, Rum, Ginger Syrup, Lichee & Mint Sorbet, Spiced Apple Sorbet and a float of Watermelon Redbull.

directions.instructions: Add first four ingredients to an ice-filled highball glass and top with Redbull float

description: A cocktail that you can’t help but love, the Black-Eyed Rye is a take on a Black-Eyed Susan, the official drink of Maryland’s biggest sporting event—the Preakness Stakes. With Rye, Ginger Beer, Lime Juice & Blackberry Simple Syrup, this has been inspired by fast horses but should be drunk slow.

directions.instruction: Shake Rye, Lime Juice & Blackberry Simple Syrup and double strain into a collins glass. Top with Ginger Beer

description: The Amora Amaro could easily be described as a love song in a glass. The combination of Amaro di Angostura, Angostura Bitters, Lime Juice & Sugar Syrup, is a perfect balance of bitter, sweet and sour notes and an ode to one’s “Love of Bitter”.

directions.instructions: Add all ingredients to an ice-filled mixing glass,  shake and double-strain into a pre-chilled coupe glass.

description: Created by Sam Ross at Attaboy, the Midnight Stringer is the perfect digestivo cocktail. With Bourbon, Fernet Branca, Lemon Juice and Sugar Syrup, this  drink is perfect for settling the stomach after a big meal.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a glass filled with crushed ice

description: Created at Dante NYC, the Mediterranean Tonic puts a Spanish coastline twist on the typical G&T.  The drink incorporates the flavours of the region with Manzanilla Sherry, Lemon and Olive, as well as a dash of saline for a subtle brininess

directions.instructions: Add all ingredients except Tonic to an ice-filled Highball glass and stir. Top with tonic
directions.garnish: Rosemary sprig, green and black olives

description: Created by Dylan Shuey + Cedric Vongerichten at Wayan NYC, the Ube Ume is a riff on a Rum Sour. As well as the Rum, Lemon Juice, Simple Syrup and Aquafaba that you would expect, this drink also has Sake and the beautiful colour of Ume Plum Liqueur & Ube extract.

directions.instructions: Shaken hard all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker before fine straining into a Nick & Nora glass.
directions.garnish: A few drops of Peychard’s Bitters

description: The Gravity Sidecar, created by Matthew Cox, is inspired by the story of Sir Isaac Newtown and incorporates apple in three ways – within the ice, the sour component and the garnish. Showcasing the beauty of the Cognac, the malic acid-adjusted Sauvignon Blanc is balanced by the Cointreau and Elderflower Cordial to create a versatile and complex drink.

directions.instructions: Add Remy Martin 1738, Cointreau, Acid-Adjusted Sauvignon Blanc, and Elderflower Cordial to a shaker. Fill with quality ice and shake. Double strain into the prepared rocks glass with an apple ice volcano.
directions.garnish: Apple and Absinthe caviar over salted tuile with an edible flower.

description: A bittersweet riff on a reverse Manhattan, the Full Monte No. 2 is adapted from a recipe created by Janelle Engelson at Gertie’s Bar in Nashville. With Montenegro Amaro replacing Vermouth, this nightcap-style cocktail also has Bourbon and Angostura Bitters.

directions.instructions: Stir all ingredients in an ice-filled mixing glass, then strain into a glass (preferably with a single ice cube)

description: Created by Kenaniah Bystrom at Essex in Seattle, the Smoke Signal Cocktail is a beautiful mix of flavours that encapsulates the forest through the Douglas Fir Liqueur, citrus through the juices and smoke through the tea syrup, all interacting through a base of Bourbon.

directions.instructions: Shake all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker, then strain into an ice-filled rocks glass

description: The Cape Town bar, Bar By Rhys, has adapted the classic Clover Club with a few tweaks to create their Delight Club cocktail. With the use of Cape Town Gin’s Pink Lady Gin, in-house Raspberry Cordial, Sour Mix (an in-house mix of lemon & Lime Juice), Aquafaba and Mole Bitters, this is as delightful as the name implies.
